title: How to Make Red Velvet Sandwich Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375º Fahrenheit or 190º Celsius.
Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl.
Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Add the vanilla extract, egg, and food coloring in a bowl. Blend well.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Combine the dry ingredients in a separate medium bowl. Mix well with a metal spoon.

steps.headline: Thoroughly incorporate the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Ensure there are no flour streaks.

steps.headline: Prepare baking your cookies.
steps.description: Place medium scoops (about 2-3 tablespoons each) on a lined or greased cookie sheet. Be sure you give each scoop ample room between each other for expansion.

steps.headline: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
steps.description: Allow the cookies to completely cool on wire cooling racks for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Make the cookies sandwiches.
steps.description: Use the cream cheese frosting as a spread. Use a generous amount on the bottom of one cookie and place the bottom of another cookie on top, like a sandwich.

text: Preheat the oven to 375º Fahrenheit or 190º Celsius.  Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl.  Mix the wet ingredients. Add the vanilla extract, egg, and food coloring in a bowl. Blend well. Mix the dry ingredients. Combine the dry ingredients in a separate medium bowl. Mix well with a metal spoon. Thoroughly incorporate the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Ensure there are no flour streaks. Prepare baking your cookies. Place medium scoops (about 2-3 tablespoons each) on a lined or greased cookie sheet. Be sure you give each scoop ample room between each other for expansion. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Allow the cookies to completely cool on wire cooling racks for about 5 minutes. Make the cookies sandwiches. Use the cream cheese frosting as a spread. Use a generous amount on the bottom of one cookie and place the bottom of another cookie on top, like a sandwich. Enjoy!
